content: As Jaron Lanier explains, when a program “requires you to interact with a computer as if it were a person, [the developers] ask you to accept in some corner of your brain that you might also be conceived of as a program.” I feel like emotionally, AI devalues human life. We are assessed and responded to based on tags, check boxes, status updates, and our location. Is this a good representation of self? Isn’t the human experience so much more than this?
